text:
Pole Arnold sponsors Women in Business entrepreneur award A financial management firm has stepped forward to sponsor one of the most keenly sought after awards. Share Setting for inaugural Women in Business Awards Share 
With the deadline for nominations approaching we are highlighting each of the categories at the Leicester Mercury Women in Business Awards. 
The awards celebrate the achievements of outstanding female entrepreneurs and businesswomen in Leicester, Leicestershire and Rutland. Read More 
The Entrepreneur of the Year Award is one of the most keenly sought after awards. 
It is being sponsored by Narborough based financial management firm Pole Arnold. Pole Arnold's Richard Todd 
Richard Todd, director of Pole Arnold, said the firm was “once again delighted to be involved in the Leicester Mercury Women in Business Awards”. 
He said: “Over half of our team are female, which include our three senior managers as well as a senior adviser, and we feel privileged to be sponsoring the Entrepreneur of the Year Award. 
“We have first-hand experience of the women within our team’s entrepreneurial contribution to our own business. 
“Team work is essential in our business and if asked I would like to think that all of the women working for us feel that they are encouraged to bring entrepreneurial skills to their work. Pole Arnold logo 
“There are plenty of female role models in the entrepreneur space although it appears we still seem to have some way to go before reaching equilibrium. P 
“Politically, a case in point being the two negotiating teams for the Brexit negotiations are currently predominately male. 
“Clearly there will be plenty of challenges for female entrepreneurs as our Brexit negotiations progress. 
“Theresa May will certainly have to use her entrepreneurial skills over the coming months to help steer the UK through the significant challenges ahead and to keep our economy growing.” 
He added: “It was clear from the high quality of entries last year that there are many entrepreneurial women in Leicestershire and we are looking forward to meeting this year’s Entrepreneur of the Year candidates. Good luck to all them all.” The Pole Arnold team outside their Narborough office 
The Leicester Mercury is hosting the awards in partnership with BHIB insurance brokers. 
The winners of the Leicester Mercury Business Awards will be announced at a glamourous event to be held at the Leicester Tigers Stadium in Leicester on September 28. 
The event will be hosted by ITV weather presenter Emma Jesson. 
There are 12 awards up for grabs and these are: 
Lifetime Achievement Award - Sponsored by BHIB 
Entrepreneur of the Year - Sponsored by Pole Arnold 
Sole Trader of the Year - Sponsored by Berkeley insurance Group 
Business Innovation Award - Sponsored by MNE Accounting 
Contribution to the Community Award - Sponsored by University of Leicester 
Rising Star Award - Sponsored by Search Consultancy 
Female Apprentice of the Year - Sponsored by Smallman and Son 
New Business of the Year - Sponsored by Easy Internet Services 
Small Business of the Year - Sponsored by FSB 
Inspirational Woman of the Year - Sponsored by Eileen Richards 
Public Sector Woman of the Year - Sponsored by Weightmans 
Business Woman of the Year - Sponsored by Torr Waterfield 
To make a nominations please visit www.leicestermercury.co.uk/womeninbusiness and complete the online form. For more information please contact Claire Dandy on 0115 905 1942 
The deadline for nominations is Friday August 25. Like us on Facebook
